twitjudge.py

Aug 27, 2019

Announcing twitjudge.py, a horrible, horrible piece of code. Initially I intended to wait to make it public until I cleaned it up a bit, but I decided to just send it and see what happens.

Twitjudge is a quick-and-dirty script that parses through your Twitter archive, displays your tweets one by one, and asks if you love it. Right now it talks like Donald Trump, which I thought was appropriate and funny when I wrote it because I was pretty punchy, but in the future I think I’ll change the prompts to emulate a more respectable Twitter user.

I’m a bleeding heart, so it’s licensed under the GPLv3. I don’t know why anyone would ever want to fork it or even use it in the first place, but hey. Principles.

You can check out the source over on my github.
